title: Emma Stone transforms into Cruella de Vil with bright red hair while filming Disney flick in London
text:
She's set to portray one of Disney's most infamous cartoon villains in a live action version of 101 Dalmatians.

And Emma Stone looked ready for action sporting a fiery red wig for her role as Cruella de Vil while filming in London on Tuesday morning.

The 30-year-old actress dressed down in a forest green bomber jacket for the steam punk-inspired scene as she made her way around set.

If she doesn't scare you: Emma Stone looked ready for action sporting a fiery red wig for her role as Cruella de Vil while filming in London on Tuesday morning

Emma's coat was bleached stained along the sleeves and worn on top of a long black T-shirt.

A black leather belt was wrapped atop her hips with a silver chain dangling down to her thigh.

She wore a pair of brown wool trousers and pounded the pavement in knee-high laced up boots.

The Academy Award-winner wore a bright red wig with curly tendrils dangling across her shoulders and fringe framing her face as a black beret rested on her head.

She showed off her porcelain skin with dramatic smokey eyeshadow highlighting her bright green eyes.

The film, which is set for a May 2021 release, is being directed by the man behind Oscar-nominated film I, Tonya — Craig Gillespie.

Stone revealed to Entertainment Tonight that her storyline comes in to play during Cruella's younger years and before Glenn Close's portrayal in the 1996 version of 101 Dalmatians.

'It's pretty trippy. It's wild,' she said of her role in the movie before adding that she walks around set thinking 'this is bananas.'

When asked about Close, she said: 'I think she's obviously the GOAT (greatest of all time), but I also have just loved the cartoon for a really long time.'

The film also stars Emma Thompson, Kirby Howell-Baptiste, Paul Walter Hauser and Emily Beecham.
